description.narrative: The Project''s expected development impacts include: (i) job creation in the areas of logistics, warehousing as well as IT services and marketing and indirectly through supply chains and other supporting services; (ii) transfer of technology by replicating proven internet business concepts in emerging markets with the goal of turning its ventures into local/regional market leading companies in the online retail space; and (iii) benefit to consumers in frontier regions and secondary cities through more choices, lower priced goods and convenient service with home delivery.

The project described under this summary of investment information document is related to project 33609 which was publically disclosed on June 17 2013 under its former name Rocket Internet. The previous summary of investment information for Rocket Internet described IFCs proposed investment into two companies: Dafiti Latam GmbH & Co. Beteiligungs KG (Dafiti) operating in Latin America and Lamoda GmbH (Lamoda) operating in Russia and Kazakhstan. The following summary relates to IFCs potential investment in Lamoda only. The proposed investment in Dafiti is now covered in an update to the summary for project 33609. Bigfoot GmbH (BF) has launched, through subsidiaries, online retailing ventures in South America, the Commonwealth of Independent States and Asia (India). BF was initiated by Rocket Internet GmbH (RI), a global online venture builder. BF has identified IFC as a potential strategic partner in its endeavor to significantly expand its e-commerce footprint in emerging markets and has invited IFC to provide equity capital to support the growth of Lamoda, its subsidiary operating in Russia and Kazakhstan, as well as possibly expanding into other former CIS countries (the Project).

name.narrative: The Project will support the operations of Lamoda in the Russian Federation Kazakhstan, as well as possibly into other former CIS countries.
